data.title: StreamLink Software Names CFO With Significant Tech Background
data.meta_description: StreamLink Software, a Cleveland company that produces grant-management technology for nonprofit and public sector institutions, has named Fred Binstock as chief financial officer. data.text:
StreamLink Software, a Cleveland company that produces grant-management technology for nonprofit and public sector institutions, has named Fred Binstock as chief financial officer.

Binstock is a certified public accountant with “more than 30 years of experience helping ventures in a variety of growth stages succeed,” SteamLink said in a news release.

Most recently, Binstock served as managing partner of Fred R. Binstock & Associates, a consulting firm that provides clients with executive guidance, part-time CFO and chief operating officer services, and financial consulting.

Previously, Binstock was CFO and treasurer of TOA Technologies, a cloud-based provider of mobile software solutions for workforce management that was based in Beachwood and was bought in 2014 by Oracle Corp.; and CFO of Radisphere Radiology, a Beachwood company that was bought in 2015 by Sheridan, the physician services division of AmSurg Corp.
